scenarioDescription:
The TOI-1062 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-1062 is a star with 0.94 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.84 times its radius. It is located 268.01 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TOI-1062 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-1062 system


TOI-1062 b

TOI-1062 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2021-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-1062 b is 10.157 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-1062 b is 2.265 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, TOI-1062 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


TOI-1062 c

TOI-1062 c was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2021-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-1062 c is 9.785 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-1062 c is 3.100 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, TOI-1062 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system TOI-1062, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: TOI-1062 - System With 2 Exoplanets
